Data Dictionary for ausbushfire

Heng-Hsieh Chang

2025-10-28

Source: vignettes/data_dictionary.Rmd
data_dictionary.Rmd

Overview

The ausbushfire_data object is a primary dataset derived from the KNMI Climate Explorer and related literature, compiled to facilitate the interactive analysis of fire risk and climate drivers in Southeastern Australia (1979–2019).

Dataset

Data Structure

The dataset contains annual observations for key fire weather metrics and climate teleconnections.

# Display the structure of the dataset
dplyr::glimpse(ausbushfire_data)
#> Rows: 41
#> Columns: 8
#> $ year         <dbl> 1979, 1980, 1981, 1982, 1983, 1984, 1985, 1986, 1987, 198…
#> $ fwi_sm       <dbl> 43.43002, 43.54102, 36.87574, 44.36889, 22.27665, 38.2921…
#> $ msr_sm       <dbl> 14.853330, 9.008294, 7.544535, 13.920410, 2.498665, 11.54…
#> $ tmax         <dbl> 32.40741, 32.46970, 32.13638, 32.70779, 29.91266, 31.3053…
#> $ precip_total <dbl> 10.522965, 12.182367, 12.010216, 9.062361, 21.097233, 11.…
#> $ iod_mean     <dbl> -0.18716278, -0.06842349, -0.20741058, 0.49036242, 0.2006…
#> $ sam_mean     <dbl> -0.6334776, -1.1506615, 0.3353702, -1.0452194, 1.1858015,…
#> $ area_burned  <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N…

Variable Definitions

This dataset uses the following variables, primarily representing annual maximum or seasonal means/totals across the study region.

Field dictionary for the ausbushfire_data dataset
Variable Units Period Description
year
1979–2019 Fire season year (aligned to the end of the season).
fwi_sm
1979–2019 Fire Weather Index (FWI) seasonal maximum. Primary measure of overall fire risk.
msr_sm
1979–2019 Monthly Severity Rating (MSR) seasonal maximum. **Reflects risk of prolonged, difficult-to-suppress fires.
tmax °C 1979–2019 Maximum Temperature (Tmax\text{Tmax}) annual mean for the fire season, a key driver of fuel dryness.
precip_total mm 1979–2019 Total Precipitation during the fire season (Sep–Feb). Indicates seasonal drought conditions.
iod_mean
1979–2019 Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) mean index (Sep–Dec). Major climate driver influencing regional drought.
sam_mean
1979–2019 Southern Annular Mode (SAM) mean index (Sep–Dec). Influences high-latitude westerly winds and rainfall patterns.
area_burned km² 1997–2018 Total burned area in the study region, reflecting actual fire impact. (Data availability starts later.)

Quick Peek

A look at the first few records:

head(ausbushfire_data)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 8
#>    year fwi_sm msr_sm  tmax precip_total iod_mean sam_mean area_burned
#>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1  1979   43.4  14.9   32.4        10.5   -0.187    -0.633          NA
#> 2  1980   43.5   9.01  32.5        12.2   -0.0684   -1.15           NA
#> 3  1981   36.9   7.54  32.1        12.0   -0.207     0.335          NA
#> 4  1982   44.4  13.9   32.7         9.06   0.490    -1.05           NA
#> 5  1983   22.3   2.50  29.9        21.1    0.201     1.19           NA
#> 6  1984   38.3  11.5   31.3        11.1   -0.135    -1.19           NA

Notes:

  • Data starts from 1979, but area_burned from 1997.
  • Intended uses: time series trends, scatter plots for relationships, map opacity for burned area.
